Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can include a fish and its natural water habitat in their drawing.
The student can label the water environment where the fish lives.
The student can illustrate and label elements that the fish needs to survive, such as water and oxygen.
The student can represent and label other plants or animals that might share the habitat with the fish.
The student can show and label relationships between the fish and other components of its environment, like plants providing shade or food for the fish.
The student can show how the habitat (like water) meets the fish's needs.
The student can illustrate that all these parts are part of a system that works together, helping the fish meet its needs.
